enableFx.hint: Locally disable the scene's auto-visual weather effects generated by SceneWeather. This only disables the display of the effects on the Scene, but not the weather itself.
enableFx.name: Enable weather effects

cloudsAlpha.hint: How visible should clouds, fog or other area-wide effects be on the scene. 0% disables clouds visually.
cloudsAlpha.name: Visibility of clouds

precipitationAlpha.hint: How visible should the display of precipitation such as rain, drizzle, snow, hail, etc. be? 0% disables precipitation visually.
precipitationAlpha.name: Visibility of precipitation

maxParticles.hint: The maximum number of displayed particles (clouds, raindrops, snowflakes, etc.) can be limited if this limits the performance on the browser. Typical values ​​are ~1000 on an older mobile device and ~28000 on a modern graphics card.
maxParticles.name: Maximum number of particles displayed

debug.hint: Enable debug logging in the console
debug.name: Enable Debugging

meteo.perceptive: The {{localize sun.amountId}} sky {{#if (eq clouds.type 'meteo.none')}} is clear.{{/if}}{{#if (ne clouds.type 'meteo.none')}} shows {{localize clouds.amountId}} {{localize clouds.heightId}} {{localize clouds.type}} bringing {{localize precipitation.amountId}} {{localize precipitation.type}}. {{/if}}The {{localize humidity.percentId}} {{localize temperature.percievedId}} air{{#if (eq wind.speedId 'meteo.calm')}} is {{localize wind.speedId}}.{{/if}}{{#if (ne wind.speedId 'meteo.calm')}} brings a {{localize wind.speedId}} from {{localize wind.directionId}}.{{/if}}({{name}})
